member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ACPLoader.ACPmenu_MenuClicked(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This public event is fired off from ACP_Menu but is handled here in order to load proper user control based on the clicked menu item.
member.remarks: Reset viewstate, another control was requested to be loaded.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ACPLoader.LoadForumControl(System.String)
member.summary: This method is used to load the proper user control. It is also responsible for finding the control and firing off the interface all controls loaded by Forum_UserSettings via Ajax use.
member.param: The ascx control we are attempting to load.
member.returns: An instance of the ascx control we loaded in the module.
member.remarks: We need viewstate to load the same subcontrol at postback.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBaseControl
member.summary: Gets/Sets all the properties we need to use in the various forum views which are loaded via the dispatch (Forum_Container) control.
member.remarks: Inherits from webcontrol because it houses the various forum view controls generated programatically and injected into the Forum_Container. This is loaded by DNNForum.vb which is originally loaded by forumcontainer. This should never need to be used without current HttpContext available. (ie. an api or scheduled task).

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBaseControl.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a new instance of the ForumBaseControl class.
member.remarks: Only called by Forum_Container.ascx.vb

member.summary: Initializes control.
member.remarks: Life cycle

member.summary: OnLoad method which calls the initalize method.
member.param: The event arguement.
member.remarks: We don't use the event arguement. Life cycle

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBaseControl.EnsureChildControls
member.summary: Needed to make sure things are all rendered.

member.summary: Render method.

member.remarks: Life cycle

member.summary: The BasePage is used to set the Title bar Title of the browser.

member.returns: An arraylist of module actions

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBaseControl.PortalID
member.summary: The PortalID the module is running in.
member.returns: The integer portalID the module is running in.

member.summary: The TabID user is accessing the module from.
member.returns: The TabID the user is accessing.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBaseControl.ModuleID
member.summary: The ModuleID being accessed.

member.summary: The Module's configuration settings.
member.returns: The configuration settings pertaining to the module instance.
member.remarks: This is necessary for every control being loaded in the module.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBaseControl.Action
member.summary: Type of action user is performing, such as new post, edit post, etc.
member.returns: The action the user is performing
member.remarks: Usually aids in Add vs. Update type situations. (Also consider that it is base for some notification items loading a template.)

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBaseControl.Descending
member.summary: If Posts are being viewed in ascending/descending mode.
member.returns: True if the posts are being shown descending by date, false if ascending.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumModuleBase
member.summary: This class should be inherited by all controls that are registred as actions in DNN that should inherit PortalModuleBase.
member.remarks: The settings class, since it normally doesn't load PortalModuleBase, should not inherit this class.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumModuleBase.CurrentForumUser
member.summary: This is the user who is viewing the forum.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumModuleBase.ProfileUserID
member.summary: This is the user who's profile we are altering (typically, the logged in user unless a forum admin).

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumModuleBase.ForumID

member.returns: An integer representing the current forum the usre is viewing. It will return -1 if there is no forumid parameter in the URL.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumModuleBase.objConfig
member.summary: This is the forum's configuration so it can be used by loaded controls.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration
member.summary: This houses all the configuration items for use through this entire module. Most of these are module settings.

member.summary: Gets the forum configuration from cache, if its not there it loads it.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.EnableRatings
member.summary: Gets if Thread ratings are enabled.
member.returns: True if post rankings are enabled, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Enabled by default.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.RatingScale
member.summary: The highest number which a thread rating can be.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.AutomatedEmailAddress
member.summary: Gets the Send From email address of all outgoing emails from this module.
member.returns: The email address for outgoing emails.
member.remarks: Default value should be admin email.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.EmailAddressDisplayName
member.summary: Gets the "Send From" friendly name instead of just email address used on outgoing email sends.
member.returns: The outgoing email's friendly name.
member.remarks: Defaults to nothing.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.MailNotification
member.summary: Gets if email notification is enabled.
member.returns: True if email notifications are enabled, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Default is enabled.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.EnablePerForumFrom
member.summary: Gets if email from address and friendly name can be overridden at the forum level.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.EnableEmailQueueTask
member.summary: Gets if email queue task is enabled.
member.returns: True if email queueing is enabled, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Disabled by default, requires scheduled task to be enabled.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.EnableEditEmails
member.summary: Gets if edit email notifications should go out.
member.returns: True if email notifications for post edits are enabled, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Default is False.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.EnableListServer
member.summary: Determines if third party extension should be used for receiving emails for a posting API.
member.remarks: This is currently not available in the user interface.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.ListServerFolder
member.summary: A folder path on the file system that should be used for storing emails.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.PrimaryAlias
member.summary: The primary Alias should only be used in email related items. This is used for full URL's that link to images in outgoing emails.
member.returns: A full http path for emails images.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.EnableBadWordFilter
member.summary: Gets if the word filter is enabled.
member.returns: True if filtering of bad words is enabled.
member.remarks: Admins must add words to filter for.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.FilterSubject
member.summary: Gets if post subjects should be filtered for bad words.
member.returns: True if post subjects should be filtered for bad words.
member.remarks: Requires users to add bad words.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.EnableUserAvatar
member.summary: Gets if the ability for users to add/show avatars is enabled.
member.returns: True if user avatars are enabled, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.AvatarProfilePropName
member.summary: Gets the profile property name for avatars.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.EnableSystemAvatar
member.summary: Gets if the module allows System Avatars.
member.returns: True if System avatars are enabled, false otherwise.
member.remarks: True by default.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.SystemAvatarPath
member.summary: Gets the System Avatar file path.
member.returns: The path to system avatars.
member.remarks: Relative to Portals/PortalID/ Directory

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.EnableRoleAvatar
member.summary: Gets if the module allows Role Avatars.
member.returns: True if Role avatars are enabled, false otherwise.
member.remarks: True by default.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.RoleAvatarPath
member.summary: Path where role avatars are stored (relative to Portals directory)

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.MaxPostImageWidth
member.summary: Gets the maximum allowed image width for post images
member.returns: Maximum allowed width for images inside the postbody
member.remarks: Added by Skeel

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads modules config settings from Module Settings based on moduleId.
member.param: The ModuleID to load the configuration for.
member.remarks: This is the base of the module settings, if none are found it creates defaults for a new module instance.

member.summary: Gets an image path for a forum theeme.
member.param: THe image name.
If the host folder directories should be included.
member.returns: The full image path including the name of the image.
member.remarks: IncludeHost should always be false (must test)

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration.GetValue(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Used to determine if a valid input is provided, if not, return default value
member.param: The object being compared.
The default value to use if the input object is nothing.
member.returns: The string value to use for the module setting.
member.remarks: This avoids any non-set configuration items and sets defaults for them.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.DNNForum
member.summary: This is initialized by the Forum_Container (dispatch).
member.remarks: This is the second classes loaded which in turn loads up other classes to generate a UI programatically. DNNForum serves as a placeholder.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.DNNForum.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiats this class (which is the basis for most UI)
member.remarks: Used to determine which UI to render (thread view, post view, group view, search results view)

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.DNNForum.CreateObject
member.summary: Initializes the proper class to render the forum UI
member.remarks: Creates a new instance of the base object as the type of forum view (ie. load the thread view UI).

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.DNNForum.Initialize
member.summary: Here to make certain the forum instance is completely assigned the proper variables
member.remarks: Used to make certain everything in the control is rendered. This actually can decrease performance (but not noticeably)

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.DNNForum.CreateChildControls
member.summary: we have to create the controls each time because they are built dynamically and loaded into Forum_Container.ascx
member.remarks: Creates all controls rendered in this class.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBaseObject
member.summary: The base object is responsible for common methods used to build the forum UI in vb code including: ForumPost, ForumThread, ForumGroup, ForumThreadSearch, ForumPortalSearch, ForumModerate
member.remarks: This is loaded by BaseControl.vb which is loaded by DNNForum.vb, which is loaded by forum container.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumType
member.summary: Options for how a forum behaves. Notifications forums are forced subscriptions. Link forums are just links, no actual forum inside.
member.remarks: In Lists table

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumType.Normal
member.summary: Normal posting/viewing type forum.

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumType.Notification
member.summary: Similar to normal, except specified roles are forced to receive an email when new threads/posts are created.

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumType.Link
member.summary: Displays as a forum but is simply a link. Does not contain any post/thread data.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBehavior
member.summary: Determines how a forum will behave in terms of viewing and post restrictions. Also includes if a forum is moderated or unmoderated.

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBehavior.PublicModerated
member.summary: Moderated forum available to all who can see module, no posting restrictions beyond being logged on.

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBehavior.PublicModeratedPostRestricted
member.summary: Moderated forum available to all who can see module, posting restrictions are set in forum permissions grid.

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBehavior.PublicUnModerated
member.summary: Unmoderated forum available to all who can see module, no posting restrictions beyond being logged on.

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBehavior.PublicUnModeratedPostRestricted
member.summary: Unmoderated forum available to all who can see module, posting restirctions are set in forum permissions grid.

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBehavior.PrivateModerated
member.summary: Moderated forum that can only be seen by users assigned perms in forum permissions grid.

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBehavior.PrivateModeratedPostRestricted
member.summary: Moderated forum that can only be seen by users assigned perms in forum permissions grid. Posting restrictions beyond being able to view apply here.

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBehavior.PrivateUnModerated
member.summary: Unmoderated forum that can only be seen by users assigned perms in forum permissions grid.

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumBehavior.PrivateUnModeratedPostRestricted
member.summary: Unmoderated forum that can only be seen by users assigned perms in forum permissions grid. Posting restrictions beyond being able to view apply here.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.PermissionKeys

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.PermissionKeys.FORUMADMIN

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.PermissionKeys.FORUMGLBMOD
member.summary: This person is moderator of all forums they can see.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.PostConnector
member.summary: The purpose of the PostConnector class is to have a centralized spot where multiple areas within the Forum Module can post to the database. This also is abstracted so third party providers, such as metaPost, can easily post messages. This also paves the way for Quick Reply as well as SMTP replies.
member.remarks: All functions should be pointed to PostToDatabase in the end.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.PostConnector.SubmitExternalPost(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: All posting from external sources are designed to go through this method. The API will take care of all security, moderation, notifications, filtering, etc. This is out of date.
member.param: The TabID (page) your forum that you wish to post to resides on.
The module you wish to post to.
The portal associated with the tab/modue and user posting.
The user posting the message.
The 'uncleansed' post subject.
The 'uncleansed' post body.
The forum you wish to post to.
The post you are replying to, if you are starting a new thread this should be equal to 0.
A string of attachments, separated by a semicolon (Not fully implemented).
A unique string used to identify how the post was submitted (this should be your own unique value for your module/task).
member.returns: An enumerator PostMessage that tells what happend (post moderated, post approved, reason rejected, etc.).
member.remarks: This is available for all outside modules/applications to post to the forum module.

A string of attachments, separated by a semicolon (Not fully implemented).
A unique string used to identify how the post was submitted (this should be your own unique value for your module/task).
Thread id if replying to existing thread. For new messages this should equal to -1
member.returns: An enumerator PostMessage that tells what happend (post moderated, post approved, reason rejected, etc.).
member.remarks: This is available for all outside modules/applications to post to the forum module.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.PostConnector.ProcessPostBody(System.String,DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration,System.Int32,DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.PostAction,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is meant for preview only and is not required prior to any post submissions (although, all posts will run through this when submitted).

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.PostConnector.ProcessPostSubject(System.String,DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.Configuration,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is meant for preview only and is not required prior to any post submissions (although, all posts will run through this when submitted).
This is used to submit a post to a specific forum from within the Forum module.
member.param: A string of comma separated integers(DNN File ID's). It is assumed that all attachments (and local post images) already exist within the DNN file system.
member.remarks: This is set as friend so only PostEdit uses this method. We want to avoid threadstatus, polls, thread icon changes from external sources (for now). Also avoiding post edits externally,.

member.summary: All posting goes through this method, it handles all permissions and validation then passes it on to the internal posting method.
member.param: A string of comma separated integers(DNN File ID's). It is assumed that all attachments (and local post images) already exist within the DNN file system.
member.returns: A message indicating what happend, ie. if the post was successfull or why it failed.
member.remarks: Internal and external methods for posting call this.

member.summary: This submits the post to the database. It also calls email notification if enabled. It takes moderation into consideration and fires off the necessary actions if needed. It also filters the post from here for security reasons as well as bad words (if enabled), and calls all parsing (for image replacement, etc.).
member.param: Should have value -1 when creating new thread.
member.remarks: All permissions and validation checks should be done prior to this method.

member.summary: This method properly assigns attachments to a post, it is assumed the files are already uploaded to the DNN file system and that configuration is enabled.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.StartEmailQueuedTasks
member.summary: This is the Email Queue Task handler. It is designed to allow email notifications to be sent using a background thread and to not worry about the ASP.NET default limitation of 25 threads since only one will be spawned to handle this. This is all methods necessary to use the core Scheduler for tasks.
member.remarks: The task actually sends the emails which were queued up using the IEmailQueueable interface.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.StartEmailQueuedTasks.#ctor(DotNetNuke.Services.Scheduling.ScheduleHistoryItem)

member.param: The task which will need to have its history updated.
member.remarks: Core part, used for auditing tasks.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.StartEmailQueuedTasks.DoWork
member.summary: Logs information to the schedule history
member.remarks: Responsible for sending the emails which were added to the queue via the IEmailQueueable inteface.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.StartEmailQueuedTasks.GetQueuedTask
member.summary: Retrieves a single queued email task for sending. The logic in the stored procedure determines which to retrieve. This is handled by WHERE ScheduleStart Date less than GetDate() ORDER BY EmailQueuePriority, DateCreated
member.remarks: Returns the outgoing email queue task.

member.param: The email task information we need to create a distribution list.
member.remarks: The inline SQL sending part has not been completed.

member.summary: Assigns basic SMTP settings exposed by DNN core (Host Settings) Then loops through each email, sends it and marks in db as each is sent (or failed send) At the end of this function we mark the task as completed.

A collection of emails to send.

member.summary: Interface used for consumption of modules wishing to schedule emails sends.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.IEmailQueueable.QueueEmail(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Used to queue one email for sending to a distribution list.
member.param: The email address seen as from.
The full name of whom the email should send from.
The priority of the outgoing email.
The HTML body of the outgoing email.
The text body of the outgoing email.
The subject of the outgoing email.
The portalID the email will be sent from.
The ModuleID which sent the email.
If true, the full name of the receiver will be shown as the from name.
The name of the stored procedure to call, or the query to use for distribution calls.
True if the DistroCall is the name of a stored procedure, otherwise it is inline SQL.
The parameters to pass to the stored procedure (if necessary)
When the email should be ready to be sent.
True if the email going out should use tokens. (not impelemented)
The path to the file to attach to the outgoing email. (not implemented)
member.returns: The EmailQueueTaskInfo object that was just queued by this function.
member.remarks: This is called from modules wishing to use the interface.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.CleanupEmailQueuedTasks
member.summary: This is the Email Queue Task handler. It is designed to allow email notifications to be sent using a background thread and to not worry about the ASP.NET default limitation of 25 threads since only one will be spawned to handle this. This is all methods necessary to use the core Scheduler for tasks.
member.remarks: Run by the DNN scheduler only. NOT FULLY TESTED.

member.remarks: Core part, used for auditing tasks.

member.summary: Logs information to the schedule history
member.remarks: This task cleans the emails which the IEmailQueueSendTask has already sent.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumPortalSettings
member.summary: Simply put, this is called to populate a 'fake' HttpContext object when HttpContext is not available (ie. scheduled tasks).
member.remarks: Although originally from the core, this is converted from a Bruce Chapman blog.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ForumPortalSettings.CreateNewPortalSettings(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of portal settings. This is used when HttpContext is not available (ie. scheduled tasks).
member.param: The portal we are creating settings for.
member.returns: An instance of portal settings.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.MockSecurity
member.summary: This class is utilized by the ModuleSecurity class to obtain permissions (because they are dependent on HttpContext and the current logged in user and provide no flexibility for scheduled tasks).
member.remarks: Because context is removed, we also have the ability to determine permissions of users beyond the one currently logged in. This permits us, as an example, to avoid a moderator removing permissions from an admin. BE CAREFULL!

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.MockSecurity.HasMockModulePermission(DotNetNuke.Security.Permissions.ModulePermissionCollection,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is a replacement for the core HasModulePermissions method, because the core method requires the currently logged in user.
member.param: A collection of module permissions.
The permission key we want to validate against.
The user we want to check the permissions of.
The portal the user is in.
member.returns: True if the user has permission.
member.remarks: The currently logged in user is not useful to us in specific use cases, such as scheduled tasks.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.MockSecurity.IsInMockRoles(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is a replacement for the core IsInRoles method, because the core method requires the currently logged in user.
member.param: The roles we want to check against.
The user we want to check the permissions of.
The portal the user is in.
member.returns: True if the user has permission.
member.remarks: The currently logged in user is not useful to us in specific use cases, such as scheduled tasks.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity
member.summary: The central class where all non-core security related checks should be done.
member.remarks: This base allows one level lower than core permissions (ie. forum level).

member.summary: Instantiates the class to create the security object.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity.IsAllowedToStartRestrictedThread
member.summary: If the user is allowed to post a new thread.
member.returns: True if the user is permitted to start a thread, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Restricted forums only.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity.IsAllowedToPostRestrictedReply
member.summary: If the user is allowed to post a reply to an existing thread.
member.returns: True if the user is permitted to reply to an existing thread, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Restricted forums only.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity.IsForumAdmin
member.summary: If the user is an administrator for the forum.
member.returns: True if the user is a forum administrator, false otherwise.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity.IsGlobalModerator
member.summary: If the user is a global moderator of all forums.
member.returns: True if the user is a global moderator, false otherwise.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity.IsAllowedToViewPrivateForum
member.summary: If the user is permitted to view the forum.
member.returns: True if the user is permitted to view the forum, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Private forums only.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity.CanAddAttachments
member.summary: If the user can add an attachment to a post.
member.returns: True if the user is permitted to add attachments, false otherwise.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity.CanPinThread
member.summary: If the user is permitted to pin a thread.
member.returns: True if the user is permitted to pin a thread, false otherwise.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity.CanLockThread
member.summary: If the user is permitted to lock a thread from further replies.
member.returns: True if the user is permitted to lock a thread, false otherwise.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity.IsModerator
member.summary: If the user is a moderator of at least one forum in the module instance.
member.returns: True if the user is a moderator in the forum instance, false otherwise.
member.remarks: This should be used when determining if the user is a moderator anywhere in this module instance (ie. not a specific forum). This has a flaw as it only works if -1 is passed in.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity.IsForumModerator
member.summary: If the user is a moderator of the specified forum.
member.returns: True if the user is a moderator of the specified forum, false otherwise.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Modules.Forum.ModuleSecurity.IsUnmoderated
member.summary: If the user is unmoderated based on forum permission
member.returns: True if the user is unmoderated, flase otherwise.
